meanings.definition: A person or thing that expedites something, especially a person employed to ensure the prompt delivery of goods.
meanings.sent1: The expediter at the shipping company ensured all packages were sent out on time.
meanings.sent2: The expediter quickly organized the warehouse to speed up the delivery process.
meanings.sent3: The expediter at the post office was so efficient that they were nicknamed 'Speedy'.
meanings.sent4: She was like an expediter of time, always finding ways to make things happen faster.
meanings.sent5: The expediter's dedication to promptness made them stand out among their colleagues.

meanings.definition: A person who speeds up a process or makes it happen more quickly.
meanings.sent1: As an expediter, he was known for his ability to accelerate project timelines.
meanings.sent2: The expediter's role in the team was crucial for meeting tight deadlines.
meanings.sent3: The expediter's superpower seemed to be making time fly by whenever they worked.
meanings.sent4: In the world of productivity, she was the expediter, always pushing for faster results.
meanings.sent5: The expediter's presence was like a fast-forward button for the entire operation.
